name: Devise
description: Devise is a flexible authentication solution for Rails based on Warden.

name: Knock
description: Seamless JWT authentication for Rails API.

name: Clearance
description: Rails authentication with email & password.

name: Devise token auth
description: Token based authentication for Rails JSON APIs.

name: Sorcery
description: Magical Authentication for Rails. Supports ActiveRecord, DataMapper, Mongoid and MongoMapper.

name: Pundit
description: Pundit provides a set of helpers which guide you in leveraging regular Ruby classes and object oriented design patterns to build a simple, robust and scaleable authorization system.

name: cancancan
description: Continuation of CanCan, the authorization Gem for Ruby on Rails.CanCan is an authorization library for Ruby on Rails which restricts what resources a given user is allowed to access. All permissions are defined in a single location (the Ability class) and not duplicated across controllers, views, and database queries.

name: rolify
description: Role management library with resource scoping.

name: acl9
description: Acl9 is a role-based authorization system that provides a concise DSL for securing your Rails application.

name: Enumerize

name: counter_culture

name: Sequenced
description: Sequenced is a simple gem that generates scoped sequential IDs for ActiveRecord models.

name: FriendlyId
description: FriendlyId is the “Swiss Army bulldozer” of slugging and permalink plugins for ActiveRecord. It allows you to create pretty URL’s and work with human-friendly strings as if they were numeric ids for ActiveRecord models.

name: AASM
description: State machines for Ruby classes (plain Ruby, Rails Active Record, Mongoid).

name: PaperTrail
description: PaperTrail lets you track changes to your models' data. It's good for auditing or versioning.

name: paranoia
description: ActiveRecord plugin allowing you to hide and restore records without actually deleting them.

name: Validates
description: Validates provides collection of useful custom validators for Rails applications, including:

name: globalize

name: social_shares

name: goldiloader

name: ActsAsTaggableOn

name: closure_tree
description: Easily and efficiently make your ActiveRecord models support hierarchies.

name: ActionStore
description: Store different kind of actions (Like, Follow, Star, Block ...) in one table via ActiveRecord Polymorphic Association.

name: Spreadsheet
description: Library is designed to read and write Spreadsheet Documents.

name: Chartkick
description: Chartkick helps your to create beautiful Javascript charts with one line of Ruby.

name: kaminari
description: A Scope & Engine based, clean, powerful, customizable and sophisticated paginator for Rails 3 and 4.

name: CKEditor

name: Slack Notifier is a simple wrapper to send notifications to Slack webhooks.

ransack

name: sunspot
description: Sunspot is a Ruby library for expressive, powerful interaction with the Solr search engine. Sunspot is built on top of the RSolr library, which provides a low-level interface for Solr interaction; Sunspot provides a simple, intuitive, expressive DSL backed by powerful features for indexing objects and searching for them.

name: searchkick
description: Intelligent search made easy with Rails and Elasticsearch.

name: Whenever

description: Redis-backed Ruby library for creating background jobs, placing them on multiple queues, and processing them later.

description: Lightweight job scheduler extension for Sidekiq

name: Sucker Punch
description: Sucker punch is a single-process Ruby asynchronous processing library.

name: Simple Form

name: active_link_to
description: active_link_to adds css 'active' class to your links.

name: cells
description: Cells allow you to encapsulate parts of your UI into components into view models. View models, or cells, are simple ruby classes that can render templates.

name: cocoon
description: Dynamic nested forms using jQuery made easy

RailsAdmin

name: Typus

name: administrate
description: A Rails engine that helps you put together a super-flexible admin dashboard.

name: Trestle
description: A modern, responsive admin framework for Ruby on Rails

name: Impressionist
description: Impressionist can log page impressions (technically action impressions), but it is not limited to that. You can log impressions multiple times per request. And you can also attach it to a model. The goal of this project is to provide customizable stats that are immediately accessible in your application as opposed to using Google Analytics and pulling data using their API.

name: Ahoy
description: Ahoy provides a solid foundation to track visits and events in Ruby, JavaScript, and native apps.

name: Lograge
description: An attempt to tame Rails' default policy to log everything.

name: byebug
description: Byebug is a simple to use, feature rich debugger for Ruby 2. It uses the new TracePoint API for execution control and the new Debug Inspector API for call stack navigation, so it doesn't depend on internal core sources.

name: pry-byebug
description: Pry navigation commands via byebug.

name: pry-rails
description: Avoid repeating yourself, use pry-rails instead of copying the initializer to every rails project. This is a small gem which causes rails console to open pry. It therefore depends on pry.

name: awesome_print
description: Awesome Print is a Ruby library that pretty prints Ruby objects in full color exposing their internal structure with proper indentation.

name: web-console
description: Web Console is a debugging tool for your Ruby on Rails applications.

name: spring
description: Spring is a Rails application preloader. It speeds up development by keeping your application running in the background so you don't need to boot it every time you run a test, rake task or migration.

name: rails-footnotes
description: Rails footnotes displays footnotes in your application for easy debugging, such as sessions, request parameters, cookies, filter chain, routes, queries, etc.

name: g
description: The Kernel.g that works like Kernel.p by using terminal-notifier or growl.

name: terminal-notifier
description: terminal-notifier is a command-line tool to send Mac OS X User Notifications, which are available in Mac OS X 10.8 and higher.

name: letter_opener
description: Preview email in the default browser instead of sending it. This means you do not need to set up email delivery in your development environment, and you no longer need to worry about accidentally sending a test email to someone else's address.

name: Better Errors
description: Better errors replaces the standard Rails error page with a much better and more useful error page.

name: If you would like to use Better Errors' advanced features (REPL, local/instance variable inspection, pretty stack frame names), you need to add the binding_ _of__caller.
RailsPanel
description: RailsPanel is a Chrome extension for Rails development that will end your tailing of development.log.

description: A fist full of code metrics

name: ResponseCodeMatchers

name: Timecop

name: VCR
